channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: No street lights working on roundabout, 15th March
item.description:
Please can you look in to the street lighting on Zoons Court Roundabout. Recently the lighting has been turned off at night (?). There have been two accidents this weekend (11th and 14th March) where cars have crashed into the roundabout. I believe that the fact there is no street lighting has been a contributing factor to these accidents. I now drive through Hucclecote / Abbeydale to get to Brockworth rather than use this road/roundabout as it is incredibly dark at night and in my opinion incredibly dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Zoons Court Roundabout, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees and bushes overgrown so difficult to get to dog poo bin and along footpath, 14th March
item.description:
Trees and bushes have not be cut back for ages and since last year it is really difficult to get too poo bin and you need to scramble up a muddy bank or push into bushes to get into the field, as the footpath along the side is overgrown. Entrance onto Gilpin Avenue from the field has been fenced off and footpath become overgrown and is no longer accessible
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 79 Larkhay Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping along Cotswold Way Footpath, 13th March
item.description:
The location is the footpath going past the POld Quarry from the cleeve Common Road. The footpath is part of the Cotswold Way and along quite a bit of its length it has a significant quantity of flytipping ranging from rubbish to tyres. Please can it be cleared up as an increasing number of walkers are using it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Dingle, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waste Plastic string / Shredded Material, 13th March
item.description:
The location is the Entrance to the Old Quarry off Cleeve Common Road. There is rubbish in front of the entrance wall but more importantly behind the wall which has been used as a burn area there is a quantity of plastic string / shredded material. Please can it be cleared up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): The Dingle, Cheltenham

item.title: Frequent flooding drainage problem, 13th March
item.description:
Every time it rains the road floods here. It has been a problem for a while and is getting worse. It floods with even a little rain. It happens by the drains on both sides of the road. Cars are forced out into the middle of the road ahead of a blind bend, in an attempt to cross at the highest point. Some days the flooding is so bad it is not passable, especially on motor bikes, cycles or on foot.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Turnpike House Greenway Lane, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet
